arch:property.oc:show_val: Two rocks with holes on them next to each other with almost 60-70 cm further from each other. Another two rocks in front of them at a slightly lower elevation (one big one smaller) The rock in front of the two rocks with holes seems like a treshold and makes the lcus seems like a door opening. Also it must be noted the this locus located right at the place that the wall L4041 ends. And L4025 looks like it is also related with this coincidence(!)
Big Rock (Sand stone or slag possible)

arch:note.arch:string: Contexts excavated in trenches were recorded using the "locus system." A locus is any discrete three-dimensional entity excavated in a trench. The key to the locus system is the recognition that a locus is any one thing. Differences in soil composition or texture are therefore as important as, for example, the difference between a pit and a wall. If two entities were distinct, they were considered separate loci and were therefore assigned separate locus numbers. It should also be noted that every context excavated in a trench was given a locus number and thus the trench itself is made up completely of excavated loci.

arch:property.oc:show_val: seems the rocks are made up of sand stones. But two of the bigger ones have door post like holes. Also one big rock between two that rocks (with holes) looks like a treshold

oc:metadata.dc:title: Kenan Tepe: Area C / Trench 4 / Locus 4018 (Locus)
